what: Example on how to use oregonfrogs for making a graph network
title: Data Visualization
code: library(oregonfrogs) library(tidyverse) library(igraph) library(ggraph)   frogs <- oregonfrogs %>%   mutate(survey_date = as.Date(survey_date, "%m/%d/%Y"),          sex = as.factor(sex)) %>%   arrange(doy) %>%   mutate(     subsite = case_when(       subsite == "W Res" ~ "West Reservoir",       subsite == "SE Pond" ~ "South East Pond",       subsite == "NE Res" ~ "North East Reservoir",       subsite == "N Res" ~ "North Reservoir",       TRUE ~ subsite     )   )  network_plot <- frogs %>%   filter(detection == "Captured") %>%   count(hab_type, water, substrate, frequency) %>%   igraph::graph_from_data_frame() %>%   ggraph('auto') +   geom_edge_fan2(     aes(color = rev(stat(index))),     alpha = 0.5,     strength = 1.2,     lineend = "round"   ) +   ggraph::geom_node_label(aes(label = name),                           vjust = 0.5,                           hjust = 0.6,                           size = 4) +   ggraph::scale_edge_colour_distiller(name = "Index",palette = 3) +   ggraph::scale_edge_alpha_continuous(name = "Index") +   ggraph::theme_graph() +   labs(title = "More frogs are captured in shallow water",        subtitle = "favourite habitat is pond or reservoir",        caption = "made with {ggraph}") +   theme(text = element_text(family = "Roboto Condensed"),         legend.position ="bottom",         plot.margin = unit(c(5,5,5,5),units = "pt"),         plot.title = element_text(size=12))  network_plot

title: Oregon Spotted A Frog (Rana Pretiosa)
text: oregonfrogs dataset valuable resource anyone interested studying ecology conservation frogs Oregon. dataset derived study conducted US Geological Survey, collected data frog populations Oregon. dataset includes information species, sex, age frogs, well location various environmental factors may affect populations. goal oregonfrogs provide high-quality dataset data exploration visualization. dataset well-organized easy use, making ideal resource data scientists, researchers, students interested exploring visualizing data related frog populations. dataset available download USGS website can accessed using variety software tools, including R, Python, Excel. One key benefits oregonfrogs dataset provides rich source data studying factors impact frog populations Oregon. example, researchers can use dataset explore relationship frog populations environmental factors temperature, precipitation, land use. can also use dataset investigate impact human activities urbanization agriculture frog populations. addition scientific value, oregonfrogs dataset also great resource data visualization storytelling. dataset includes wealth information can used create compelling visualizations narratives communicate importance frog conservation wider audience. example, data visualizations can used show frog populations changed time highlight impact environmental factors frog populations. Overall, oregonfrogs dataset valuable resource anyone interested studying ecology conservation frogs Oregon. dataset provides rich source data research analysis, well great opportunity data visualization storytelling. making dataset available public, US Geological Survey provided valuable resource scientists, researchers, students interested studying natural world promoting conservation efforts.

code: library(oregonfrogs) data(package = 'oregonfrogs') head(oregonfrogs)   detection survey_date doy      long      lat sex frequency interval subsite 1  Captured  2018-09-25 268 -121.7903 43.76502   0   164.169        0 SE Pond 2 No visual  2018-10-02 275 -121.7905 43.76503   0   164.169        1 SE Pond 3 No visual  2018-10-09 282 -121.7906 43.76477   0   164.169        2 SE Pond 4 No visual  2018-10-15 288 -121.7907 43.76483   0   164.169        3 SE Pond 5 No visual  2018-10-22 295 -121.7906 43.76479   0   164.169        4 SE Pond 6 No visual  2018-11-01 305 -121.7898 43.76470   0   164.169        5 SE Pond   hab_type         water       type      structure         substrate    beaver 1     Pond    Deep water Marsh/Pond Herbaceous veg Unknown substrate No beaver 2     Pond    Deep water Marsh/Pond           Open Unknown substrate No beaver 3     Pond Shallow water Marsh/Pond Herbaceous veg Unknown substrate No beaver 4     Pond    Deep water Marsh/Pond   Woody debris Unknown substrate No beaver 5     Pond    Deep water Marsh/Pond      Woody veg Unknown substrate No beaver 6     Pond    Deep water Marsh/Pond Herbaceous veg Unknown substrate No beaver

what: Oregon Spotted a Frog (Rana pretiosa) — oregonfrogs
title: Oregon Spotted a Frog (Rana pretiosa) — oregonfrogs
text: Telemetry habitat use Crane Prairie Reservoir Oregon, USA. Radio-telemetry used study late-season movement habitat use Oregon spotted frogs (Rana pretiosa) Crane Prairie Reservoir Oregon. dataset includes individual frog location data habitat use tracking event occurred roughly weekly September late November 2018.

title: Oregon Spotted a Frog (Rana pretiosa) — oregonfrogs
Oregon Spotted a Frog (Rana pretiosa) — oregonfrogs
text: data frame 311 rows 15 cols. Variables: subsite character, location second level (Cow Camp Pond,Cow Camp River,N Res,NE Res,SE Pond,W Res) hab_type character,	location third level (Pond,Reservoir,River) survey_date date,	date doy integer,	Ordinal day January 1, 2018 telemetry data collected frequency numeric,	Unique transmitter frequency associated individual frog long numeric,	long coordinates lat numeric,	lat coordinates interval character,	integer (0 12) sex character,	gender - binary (0,1) water character,	water (Deep water,water,Shallow water,Unknown water) type character,	water type (Marsh/Pond,Non-aquatic,Reservoir,Stream/Canal) structure character,	structure (Herbaceous veg,Leaf litter,Open,Woody debris,Woody veg) substrate character,	substrate (Flocc,Mineral soil,Organic soil,Unknown substrate) beaver character,	beaver (Burrow,Channel/runway,Lodge,beaver) detection character,	detection type (Captured,visual,Visual)
